title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-6.4 - Complaints
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-6.4 - Complaints

State Regulations
(a) A railroad
company, or the assessing unit in which the railroad real property is located, may obtain administrative review of the tentative railroad ceiling by serving a
written complaint specifying its objections as provided herein. (b) The complaint shall be served upon the
commissioner and the railroad company or assessing unit, as the case may be, at
least five days before the hearing date. On or before the hearing date, a
complainant shall file an affidavit with the commissioner demonstrating
compliance with this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8200-6.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
